title: tryndamere no boots build viable?
body: i was thinking if i just went {{item:3046}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3172}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3153}} i would have 417 movespeed, which is almost as fast as singed with movespeed quints and boots of swiftness and about 10 movespeed faster then a ranged carry. would this work?

replies.body: it is a viable build, but only if you are fed, late game you would sell shiv for GA probs (when everyone has 5+ items)

Yeah, a lot of people will trade Berserker's Greaves for Zephyr late game. I like to do it as an ADC on those super long games where I have the gold for it at the end, unless I have huge reason to keep homeguards. Do it, though I still suggest boots being part of your build. Perhaps you can get away with normal boots (they are cheap anyway) until you need the inventory space.

Trading out boots for zephyr late game is not unheard of. In Tryndamere's case it would be better.

You don't need too much movespeed for chasing, since you have a low cooldown dash ability that deals damage, on top of a massive slow that also lowers a targets damage output by a flat percentage, which is enhanced if they aren't facing you. Even if they try to turn around on you, you have 5 WHOLE SECONDS OF INVULNERABILITY TO ESCAPE/KILL THEIR ENTIRE TEAM WITH, which also grants instant fury to heal with.
